ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
Pychop is a Python library designed to facilitate numerical experimentation with low-precision arithmetic.
It supports customizable floating-point formats and a comprehensive set of rounding modes,
integrating seamlessly with NumPy, PyTorch, and JAX for efficient low-precision emulation
in deep learning and scientific computations.
about.summary: Python library for simulating low precision floating-point arithmetic

about.description:
Pychop is a Python library designed to facilitate numerical experimentation with low-precision arithmetic.
It supports customizable floating-point formats and a comprehensive set of rounding modes,
integrating seamlessly with NumPy, PyTorch, and JAX for efficient low-precision emulation
in deep learning and scientific computations.
about.summary: Python library for simulating low precision floating-point arithmetic

name: pychop
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pychop" %}
{% set version = "0.3.8" %}

package:
  name: {{ name }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/p/pychop/pychop-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 8a97a818a04fc37d9f591eae7afc79766f53d5a64451450649b3baad67ee8011

build:
  number: 0
  script:
    - {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  noarch: python

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - setuptools
    - numpy >=1.17.2
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - numpy >=1.17.2
    - pandas
    - dask
    - pytorch >=1.12
    - jax >=0.4.8

test:
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - scipy
    - pytest
    - pip
  imports:
    - pychop
    - pychop.np
    - pychop.tch
    - pychop.jx
  commands:
    - pip check

about:
  home: https://github.com/inexascale/pychop
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Python library for simulating low precision floating-point arithmetic
  description: |
    Pychop is a Python library designed to facilitate numerical experimentation with low-precision arithmetic. 
    It supports customizable floating-point formats and a comprehensive set of rounding modes, 
    integrating seamlessly with NumPy, PyTorch, and JAX for efficient low-precision emulation 
    in deep learning and scientific computations.
  doc_url: https://pychop.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest
  dev_url: https://github.com/inexascale/pychop
  license_family: MIT

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - eccarson
    - chenxinye
